original_title: Sri Lanka mid day shares edge down on profit taking after gaining rally
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka’s shares edged down in mid-day trade on Friday, on profit taking as the market had continuously been on green after debt restructuring assurances by major creditors, an analyst said.
All Share Price Index was down 0.86 percent or 83.15 points to 9,620.33, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was down by 0.57 percent or 16.34 points to 2,849.59.
“Profit taking can be observed as the market was active during past days due to investors were overwhelmed by the China’s debt restructuring assurance,” an analyst said.
“It is mainly taking place in the banking sector counters because everyone has brought in lower prices and are making money at this level.”
The Market generated a revenue of 1.5 billion rupees within 1130 hours.
The top losers were Sampath Bank, Commercial Bank and Melstacorp. (Colombo/ Mar 10/2023)
